Doc flies upward, trying to get above the minion pursuing him. He
thens tra=
nsforms and fires at the other during his freefall and
transforms back just=
 over the water.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007=
@...> wrote:
>
> ::Rodimus Prime/Kup::
> 
> Rodimus and Kup both dive deep =
into the water to avoid the Sweeps
attacks.
> 
> They both then bob back to=
 the surface with their rifles drawn/ They
each fire three shots at each at=
tacking Sweep. Hopefully they would be
dealt with that easily because Rodim=
us had a new target. If the past
was coming back Rodimus wanted to take car=
e of Cyclonus and Scourge.
> 
> Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:  =
                             
>  Above the city sweeps keep up a steady pou=
nding as they move above and
>  amidst the buildings. Like a wave of swarm =
their disintegration beams
>  blaze into the buildings below with a frighte=
ning intensity. As the
>  defensive shields go up and the missile battery o=
pens fire on Scourge,
>  like killer bees on the warpath several sweeps fly=
 at the battery, the
>  air seeming to almost buzz with laserfire! The defe=
nders at the missile
>  battery do manage to pull down a few sweeps, only t=
o have a few more
>  take their place and continue firing. 
>  
>  Lord Per=
seus and the troops have a similar effect as they lay into the
>  sweeps, t=
heir blasts cutting down a few sweeps. For a moment there is a
>  reprieve =
as sweeps explode with a satisfying blaze of fire and light.
>  But then mo=
re come from different directions. It's like firing into a
>  swarm, you hi=
t a few, and a few more come. Their attacks coming from
>  everywhere above=
 them and to the sides, laser blasts and disintegration
>  beams rock their=
 fortified area, seeking to terminate those housed
>  within!
>  
>  Withou=
t any commands from Nightstrike and Darkfate the sweeps around
>  the Maxim=
al base just continue to pound on it from above, seemingly
>  content to ke=
ep anything on the inside the base pent up there. Anything
>  so foolish as=
 to step out of its doors face their cannons with a most
>  grueling intens=
ity!
>  
>  In the air above Scourge is only slightly impressed as the Maxi=
mal
>  (Ravenchief) evades his blast, hoever it is the fact that he is igno=
red
>  totally that sets his nerves on edge. It is then they his proximity
=
>  alarms flip on warning him of the incoming missiles. He chuckles, "Only
=
>  six?? They don't know me!" With a blast of power he drops down to near
>=
  street level, zipping between tall buildings, far more agile then
>  simp=
le missiles. As several of them hit structures rather then him his
>  laugh=
 echoes through the streets below. 
>  
>  Scourge's laugh slows a bit as h=
e realizes that a few missiles continue
>  to follow him then. "Heat seeker=
s." He grumbles for a moment and then
>  chuckles, "This should be fun!" Fl=
ying towards one of the large
>  buildings he peppers it with laser fire, s=
etting it ablaze. Then with a
>  mighty thrust from his hover jets, which p=
ut out much less heat, he
>  pushes to the side and around the building as =
the building which is now
>  much hotter then he receives the brunt of the =
remaining missile
>  strikes. His laugh echoes once again through the stree=
ts as several
>  sweeps meet him there and begin to rain destruction! 
>  
=
>  In the air somewhat closer to the shoreline, Cyclonus had continued in
>=
  the direction he was going, his jets flaring with power, the wind
>  almo=
st screaming as it moved past him! As his own missiles exploded
>  spectacu=
larly at the railing he merely flew through blaze, with all the
>  attendan=
t dramatic glory, allowing the heat of the explosion to either
>  attract R=
avenchief's missiles attention or detonate them. In either
>  case he rose =
high into the air, careful to stay out of the line of fire
>  from those on=
 the shoreline below, as the missles just added to the
>  wreckage that fel=
l towards the waters below. 
>  
>  Shifting to his robot mode, Cyclonus tu=
rned his gaze to the approaching
>  Ravenchief, his form seeming to almost =
radiate power as he floated in
>  mid air. He is tall and almost regal, see=
ming to be almost made for the
>  air boued as he was on powerful thrusters=
 that took the place of his
>  feet. 
>  
>  His voice is deep and resonate=
, exactly the pitch and timber of the
>  Cyclonus of old, "Is this what you=
 wanted Maximal?" Cyclonus lets go
>  with two more missiles, quickly the a=
ir behind them began to spin, then
>  ripple and finally burst aflame as th=
ey pulled away from Cyclonus and
>  streaked towards Ravenchief!
>  
>  At =
the shoreline below Doc manages to hit one of the two sweeps
>  menacing hi=
m. However these sweeps are not jets and share very few of
>  their frailti=
es; they are made for hunting and pursuing hostile prey,
>  and their armor=
 is extremely durable. The laser fire smokes along the
>  surface of the sw=
eep's armor, leaving a nasty gash, but does not bring
>  it down. The sweep=
s just slow and stop just over the edge of the water
>  and open up with a =
barrage of laser fire at Doc's position.
>  
>  Meanwhile from above severa=
l sweeps move down following Rodimus and
>  kup, also opening up with canno=
n fire at the swimming and hopefully

ston
